Item.Name: BRAINSTORM DVD Christopher Walken FREE SHIP
Item.Description: FREE DOMESTIC SHIPPING IF YOU USE THE BUY IT NOW FEATURE. This dvd has been opened and is in like new condition. Natalie Wood made her last screen appearance in Brainstorm; in fact, she died before the film was completed, necessitating extensive rewrites. Wood's character is secondary to the one played by Christopher Walken. A research scientist, Walken has been experimenting with a revolutionary brain-reading device. This wondrous machine is able to read a person's thought processes and translate these to videotape. When Walken wants to study the brainwaves of his late partner Louise Fletcher, he finds himself seriously at odds with his superiors-not to mention several ominous-looking government types, headed by Cliff Robertson. Aspect Ratio 2.35:1 WIDESCREEN. Theatrical Trailer. YOU MUST HAVE A CONFIRMED ADDRESS IF PAYING BY PAY PAL. FREE DOMESTIC SHIPPING IF YOU USE THE BUY IT NOW FEATURE. Item.Name: Classical Guitar Technique/Musicianship VIDEO
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:18px; color:#00000; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#000000; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } Classical Guitar Technique/Musicianship VIDEO Here's a lesson for both classical musicians and fingerstyle guitarists who want to discover their "natural dexterity" for speed, tone and effortless technique! Whether you are a beginning or advanced guitarist, you will benefit from Fred Hand's in-depth explorationof the fundamental principles of classical guitar technique. "Your body and mind have an innate ability to express the music that you hear," says Hand, "you only need to tap into this source." By learning the essentials of good playing, such as posture, relaxation, fingernail shaping and the correct application of the free stroke and rest stroke, you will quickly become a smoother and more efficient player. As you practice your arpeggios, scales, vibrato, trills and cross-string trills, you'll learn to apply them to beautiful classical-style pieces such as John Dowland's "Lady Hunnsden's Puffe" and a dance by Gaspar Sanz. Hand's own compositions, "A Celtic Tale," "Heartsong " and "Lesley's Song" are perfect examples of the application of classical techniques to pieces in a contemporary setting. This is a lesson that will dramatically improve the playing of both classical musicians and fingerstyle guitarists of other tradition. About Frederic Frederick Hand's 30-year recording, composing and touring career has garnered rave reviews from critics throughout the world. He has performed with Luciano Pavarotti, Placido Domingo, Zubin Mehta, Pierre Boulez, The Waverly Consort, Mostly Mozart Orchestra and his own ensemble, Jazzantiqua. He arranged and performed the theme from Academy Award-winning film "Kramer Vs. Kramer," which led to best-selling recordings "Baroque and On The Street" (Sony) and "Jazzantiqua" (Musicmasters/BMG). Mr. Hand is currently on the faculty of Mannes College of Music and has given masterclasses at the New England Conservatory, Boston Conservatory, Yale University and Emory University. His compositions are published and recorded around the world. He is the 1996 Emmy-award winning composer for "The Guiding Light." The New York Times wrote, "He played unerringly, with all the verve and spirit that one could ask," while the Milwaulkee Sentinel called Hand "A brilliant master of the guitar." 75 Minute VHS Video, In Gently Used Condition. Item.Name: Raymond Massey Speckled Band 1931 Lot of 3
Item.Description: Here's a very interesting lot of 3 photos from the 1931 British & Dominions Film Corportation production of "The Speckled Band." Short-running (48 minutes) mystery marked the film debut of Raymond Massey, who portrayed the legendary sleuth Sherlock Holmes. That's Massey at center in the JPG. Forgive the poor scan -- actual photo is much better. Massey is not shown in the other 2 photos. All 3 of the 8 X 10 original photos show edge and corner wear, a pinhole or two here and there and some other problems, but nothing detracts too much. Editor's crayon code in upper left of each photo can be easily and completely removed by using a soft, NON-MOIST tissue. Overall condition merits good-minus, considering age and handling. An attractive lot perhaps for the more advanced film collector, taking into account it was Massey's first film. Come sleeved and with backing board. Buyer to pay $3.50 for secure first-class shipping. Please see my other top-quality and interesting old movie photos, other photos, books, paper collectibles and memorabilia now on sale. A COLOSSAL ADVENTURE ODYSSEY THAT TURNS BACK THE HANDS OF TIME TO THE VERY BEGINNING OF MAN'S EXISTANCE. 80,000 YEARS AGO, WHEN MAN ROAMED THE EARTH, HE WAS EXPOSED TO THE MANY HARSH ELEMENTS OF NATURE. AGAINST THE PERILOUS ATMOSPHERE OF RUGGED TERRAIN, RIVAL TRIBES AND SAVAGE BEASTS, "QUEST FOR FIRE" EXAMINES A PEACEFUL TRIBE'S SEARCH FOR THAT ALL IMPORTANT ELEMENT--FIRE, AND THE KNOWLEDGE TO CREATE IT. FOCUSING ON HUMAN DRAMA AS WELL AS REALISTIC INSIGHTS INTO PREHISTORIC MAN, THE CONSTANT STRUGGLE FOR SURVIVAL IS VIVIDLY RECREATED IN THIS SENSATIONAL PRODUCTION. Item.Name: CALL OF THE WILD*Jack London*DVD*NEW*
Item.Description: CALL OF THE WILD STARRING: Rick Schroder and Mia Sara Brand New Factory Sealed DVD Never Opened! Never Viewed! Call of the Wild, Jack London's classic story of a young man's adventure in the Yukon, is transformed into a breathtaking, action packed film starring Lonesome Dove's Rick Schroder and Mia Sara (Ferris Bueller's Day Off). Shot on location in the rustic wilderness of British Columbia, it's an exciting film the whole family will enjoy. It's 1897 and young John Thorton feels the need to break free from his father's overbearing grip. John jumps a steamer north to join the frenzied fever of the Yukon Gold Rush. But "the call of the wild" is not the place pictured in his romantic dreams. Harsh weather, unforgiving terrain, hostile Indians and cutthroat miners remind him he is far from home. John Thorton is struggling for survival, but he has three good reasons to stay alive: Charlie, a wise Indian who becomes his friend and teacher, Sue, the first true love of his life, and Buck the courageous dog who helps show him the true meaning of life. Together they will share joy and sorrow in an unforgetable adventure of discovery. A real classic. DVD DETAILS: Rated G; 97 minutes; Color; Coded Region 1 (US and Canada). When the studios started to realize there was a mass market for their movie posters, they have gone back and re-issued several of them. This poster is one of them. It is identical to the first printing done by the studio. Only an appraiser could probably tell the difference. Now, as far as collectability goes, to give you an example - First printings for BARBARELLA posters sell for a few hundred dollars (if you can even find one). The studio realized that this was not appropriate for the average person who wanted the poster for their wall and so they went back and re-issued the poster in mass quantity and so the value of the re-issues is not like the first printings, yet you get basically the same quality. This provides an affordable alternative for someone to obtain a poster for a movie like BARBARELLA. Again, this is NOT a poster-house reprint. Those are photocopies of the originals and the quality is not nearly as good. I offer a complete satisfaction guarantee on all my products!!! The studio realized that this was not appropriate for the average person who wanted the poster for their wall and so they went back and re-issued the poster in mass quantity and so the value of the re-issues is not like the first printings, yet you get basically the same quality. This provides an affordable alternative for someone to obtain a poster for a movie like A CLOCKWORK ORANGE. Again, this is NOT a poster-house reprint. Those are photocopies of the originals and the quality is not nearly as good. I offer a complete satisfaction guarantee on all my products!!! Item.Name: OSMOSIS JONES Farrelly Bros. Bill Murray DVD
Item.Description: OSMOSIS JONES Farrelly Bros. Bill Murray NEW, UNOPENED, FACTORY SEALED! DVD After the stiff attempts at realism in many recent features, it's a treat to see broad cartoon-style animation on the big screen in Osmosis Jones, a spoof of cop movies set inside the human body. The title character (voice by Chris Rock) is a street-smart white blood cell, working for Frank's immune system. He and Drix (David Hyde Pierce), an over-the-counter cold capsule, are reluctant partners fighting what appears to be a minor infection. Osmosis discovers Frank has really contracted a fatal virus, Thrax (Laurence Fishburne): he battles a corrupt body politic led by a venal mayor (William Shatner) to save Frank's life and win the affection of the mayor's aide, Leah (Brandy Norwood). Rock's motor-mouth delivery can get annoying, but it contrasts nicely with straight arrow Drix (imagine a fussy Buzz Lightyear). Excellent drawing and a powerful vocal performance make Thrax a genuinely frightening villain. DVD Features: Regional Code: Region .1 Layers: Dual Audio Tracks: English 5.1, French 5.1, Spanish 2.0 DTS Audio Tracks: none Subtitles: French, Closed-captioned: Yes Ratios: Widescreen No A/R, Anamorphic Special Features: Under the Microscope - Behind the Scenes Commentary By Director, Writers, Producers including Farrelly Bros. Deleted "Spleens" Cell to Cinema Process Reel Frank's Highlight Reel Cast/Crew Bios Trailers ADD 3.95 SHIPPING(FIRM).I SHIP EVERYDAY EXCEPT SUNDAY. PAYPAL OR MONEY ORDER ONLY. (NO CHECKS) PLEASE SEE MY OTHER DVD AUCTIONS. ALL MY DVD'S ARE NEW,UNOPENED,AND FACTORY SEALED! REGION 1, NO IMPORTS!! JUST LIKE WHAT YOU BUY IN THE STORE! ADD ONLY 1.50 SHIPPING FOR EACH ADDITIONAL DVD.THREE OR MORE DVD'S GETS PRIORITY SHIPPING.PLEASE CONTACT ME WITHIN 48 HOURS TO ARRANGE PAYMENT. PAYMENT DUE WITHIN 10 DAYS OF AUCTION END. Positive and Negative feedback will be given so only bid if you are willing to follow thru.THANK YOU.

Item.Description: NON-RENTAL LIKE NEW.///PLAYS LIKE NEW YOU ARE BIDDING OF AN OUT OF PRINT COPY OF Walt Disney's "Snow White And The Seven Dwarfs" DEFINITELY A MOVIE, FOR ALL TO ENJOY VHS.color Hi-Fi Stero. Digitally Mastered. 84 minutes.Snow White And The Secen Dwarfs is the definitive Disney masterpiece. The first full-length animated feature ever made, it is timeless in its perfection and remains the most revered of all Disney films from Pinocchio and Bambi, to Beauty And The Beast and Aladin. Disney's immortal fairy tale springs to life as the lovely Snow White finds romance with a charming young Prince. When Snow White's vain and wicked stepmother, the Queen, consults her magic Mirror, her worst fear is confirmed - that Snow White's beauty surpasses even her own! Snow White is forced to flee into the forest, where she befriends seven lovable dwarfs - Dopey, Sleepy, Sneezy, Grumpy, Bashful, Happy and Doc. But despite the dwarfs' loyalty, they cannot protect Snow White against the Queen's evil spell...which can only be broken by Love's First Kiss! Fully restored to its original brilliance, "Snow White And The Seven Dwarfs overflows with heartwarming romance, rousing adventure, and enchanting music. Now you can finally own the legendary masterpiece that has become a world treasure for all generations! Shipping will be $3.50 for PRIORITY MAIL Click here to Visit my Other Auctions. Harry wanted to get rich and he wanted to get rich quick. An electronics genius and avid gambler, he decided to combine the two and devise an elaborate scheme to "cash in" on all the action in Las Vegas. But Harry's miscalculations cost him his life. When Kevin Koch, a rather common policeman, accidentally stumbles on Harry's rather cold corpse, the action begins. Determined to make a name for himself, Koch sears to expose the killers. Through the glitz and glitter of Las Vegas, Koch stalks the killers....but when they meet, it's a DEADLY IMPACT. Item.Name: Nightmare On Elm Street 3 ~Robt. Englund~VHS
Item.Description: A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET 3 Dream Warriors Robert Englund -- Patricia Arquette -- Heather Langenkamp -- Laurence Fishburne Priscilla Pointer -- Craig Wasson VHS The best of the Elm Street sequels, this creepy, surreal fantasy features terrific effects, a fine young cast, and an air of grim fatalism that sets it apart from its successors. Patricia Arquette stars as Kristen, whose nightmare leads to a slashed wrist which looks suspiciously like a suicide attempt. She is placed in a hospital psychiatric ward with a group of six other troubled teens, who all dream about the same horribly burned man, Freddy Krueger (Robert Englund) trying to kill them. Perhaps the most unusual thing about this picture, however, is the unexpected depth of sadness running through it. There are some achingly sweet moments in this otherwise frightening film which, though not disruptive, are impossible to analyze. The first and most bizarre of these is the entrance of dream researcher Nancy Thompson (Heather Langenkamp), which inexplicably causes most viewers to get misty-eyed, and there are several similar scenes throughout the film. One answer can be found in the sensitive direction of Chuck Russell, who emphasizes the tragedy and utter hopelessness in these kids' lives and manages to wring some unexpectedly perceptive turns from his cast. This is a film in which a great deal of care was obviously lavished on individual scenes (the sets are outstanding) and performances. The results are well worth repeated viewings, and prove that sequels don't necessarily have to be inferior films. This video is previously viewed but from a private collection in its original box. The box has some wear but overall is in good condition. The tape is in excellent condition. Item.Name: Funny Girl (1985) VHS Oscar Winner
Item.Description: FORMER RENTAL-GUARANTEED TO PLAY WELL 1968 Academy Award Winner Best Actress Barbra Streisand One of the most popular movie musicals ever made, FUNNY GIRL follows the early career of stage comedienne Fanny Brice - a role that earned Barbra Streisand the 1968 Oscar for Best Actress. As the film opens, only her mother believes Fanny can make it in show business. When she gets her first break at Keeney's Music Hall, her hilarious debut as a rollerskating chorus girl gets her hired as a comedienne. A year later Fanny is working for Florenz Ziegfeld in his famous Follies and brings the house down with an outrageous and unplanned number. Fanny becomes a star, falls in love and marries Nick Arnstein (Omar Sharif), a handsome gambler whose luck doesn't hold up. The film's many memorable songs include Don't Rain On My Parade and the Streisand classic People. Studio: Columbia Pictures and Rastar Productions Sound option: VHS hi-fi stereo Rated: G Tape: color, Approx. 165 minutes Stars: Barbra Streisand, Omar Sharif, Kay Medford, Anne Francis, Walter Pidgeon (as Florenz Ziegfeld) Musical numbers directed by: Herbert Ross Music by: Jule Styne Lyrics by: Bob Merrill Based on the musical play by: Isobel Lennart Screenplay by: Isobel Lennart Produced by: Ray Stark Directed by: William Wyler Production designed by: Gene Callahan Musical supervision: Walter Scharf Miss Streisand's costumes by: Irene Sharaff This tape was NEVER A RENTAL! Item.Description: This classic I Love Lucy Video is from the CBS/COLUMBIA HOUSE VIDEO LIBRARY Collection ! It is RARE and HARD TO FIND ! This one is titled- NEIGHBORS FIGHTS ! It features 3 Hilarious episodes that are sure to bring laughs to everyone - both young and old ! The episodes are ; THE COURTROOM- As a surprise Wedding Anniversary gift for the Mertzes, the Ricardos buy their dear old friends a television set. The problems begin when they can't get a clear reception and fool with the knobs. Will this "gift" put an end to their good friendship? BREAKING THE LEASE- When the Ricardos bring their new baby Little Ricky home from the hospital, not everyone in the building is thrilled to hear him exercising his lungs all night ! After Mrs. Trumball complains to the Mertzes -their friendship is put to the test ! And in NEVER DO BUSINESS WITH FRIENDS- When Ricky buys Lucy a new washing machine, Ethel gets envious. As a gesture of kindness the Ricardos decide to sell their old -but still operating , machine to the Mertzes. Problems arise when the old machine "poops" out on the new owners ! THese are 3 very funny episodes that focus on the relationship between these 2 lovely couples ! Here's your chance to own a copy or give one away as a Holiday gift to someone in your life who could use some laughs ! In it's original Hard-cover collector's box, this video is in EXCELLENT condition. NOT a former rental- this video was gently used in a private home collection and fewed a few times. Complete unedited original version. Harold Lloyd is at his absolute best in Movie Crazy, often considered the finest of his sound features. Portraying the young, aspiring and overly clumsy Harold Hall, captivated by the glamour and allure of the Hollywood movie industry, he accidentally summits another's photograph which earns him a major studio screen test. Unfortunately, Harold lacks the studio's sought after "leading man" looks, and embarks on a series of hilarious misadventures on the studio lot. Constance Cummings gives a wonderful supporting performance! Harold Lloyd at his best! New in shrinkwrap! Distributed by Flashback Films. Recorded in SP Mode. Embraced for her lovable, spirited nature, Mulan is a young girl who doesn't quite fit into her tradition-bound society. When the invading Hun army comes charging over China's Great Wall, Mulan' s aging father is ordered into battle. To spare him from harm, Mulan disguises herself as a soldier and secretly takes his place in the Imperial army, training with a comical, ragtag troop, led by the courageous Captain Shang. never far away, are Mulan s hilarious guardian dragon, Mushu, and lucky cricket, Cri-Kee. Item.Name: Carter Wong"The 18 Bronzemen"rare VHS
Item.Description: THE 18 BRONZEMEN China is in a state of upheaval. The Manchurians have invaded. They target one of the Ming dynasty's most loyal patriots, a general, and eliminate him along with many others. The only survivor of the massacre is the General's infant son, Shao Lung. He and another young boy, Tien Pang, end up at Shao Lin Temple and begin to learn the martial arts. The training is meant to prepare the young men for a series of 36 tests that must eventually be passed, the last being the fiercely challenging and usually fatal test of the 18 Bronzemen. After twenty years of devotion, the time at last comes to take on the 36 tests. Only by passing the tests can Shao Lung meet his destiny. Chinese language widescreen edition with English subtitles packaged in a white case (sorry no color insert). Will play in all US VCR's. Mint condition. Mega RARE! Item.Description: 101 Dalmations and 102 Dalmations DVD Set New This DVD set is brand new and factory sealed. Shipping will cost $4.25. I accept paypal, billpoint, cash, and international money orders. This DVD package includes both 101 and 102 Dalmations. Unleashing every ounce of Disney magic, 101 Dalmatians thrilled audiences of all ages with fast-paced adventure and comedy - featuring a brilliant performance by five-time Academy Award nominee Glenn Close as Cruella De Vil. Achieving new heights of hilarity, Disney's all-time classic puppy tale came to life as a worldwide box office sensation. In their small London flat, Dalmatians Pongo and Perdy, and their human "pets" Roger and Anita, are overjoyed by the arrival of 15 puppies. But when the spotted-fur-loving Ms. De Vil and her clumsy cohorts, Jasper and Horace, dognap the litter - along with every other Dalmatian pup in London - Pongo and Perdy must rally the town's animals to their rescue. The plan hurls them towards a thrilling climax filled with uproarious moments as the puppies attempt to outwit their captors and bring on a final showdown with Cruella! 102 Dalmations Cruella De Vil has been conditioned like Pavlov's dogs to resist her passion for pups, but is she really reformed? When it all comes undone, she's doggoned determined to gather 101 Dalmatians to make her black and white coat. Make that 102 Dalmatians: She's decided to add a hood! Glenn Close, G rard Depardieu and Ioan Gruffudd star. STARRING: Glenn Close, Jeff Daniels. DIRECTED BY: Stephen Herek. SPECIAL FEATURES: Color, Closed-captioned. PLEASE NOTE: Two Disc Set. Item.Name: JUNE 1914 THE THEATRE-George M. Cohan & MORE!
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#336666; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#000000; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } JUNE 1914 THE THEATRE-George M. Cohan & MORE! I came into a huge collection of THE THEATRE magazines this weekend - circa 1900 to 1918. A lot of them have great articles, great pics of the great theatrical people of that time, and lots of wonderful ads - some black & white and some color. So from this wonderful collection of paper I am offering: A complete June 1914 issue of THE THEATRE. I can't even begin to tell you what you get inside but I will detail some of the highlights: A very nice FRAMEABLE cover (light carboard) of MISS LAURETTE TAYLOR in "Peg O' My Heart"; a back cover (light cardboard) color page for PACKARD; black and white ads for Lord & Taylor ("Onyx Hosiery"); Columbia Graphophone Co (endorsed by Vernon Castle); Good Year; Wilcox & White Co Pianos; Victrola; Burgesser Hats; Lucky Strike Cigarettes; Speedway Runabout; BVD; Riz La Famous Cigarette Papers; Egyptian Deities Cigarettes; Violet Sec Toilet Water. Color ad (inside back cover) for MURAD Cigarettes. B&W pictures/articles of Ethel Barrymore, Marie Nordstrom, Marie Wallace, Flo Hart, Bessie Gross, Lydia Lopokova, Inez Plummer, Margaret Anglin, Cecil Kern, Eva Davenport, Grace George, Lois Meredith, Ann Swinburne, Grace Valentine, Lawrence Dorsay, Robert Mantell, Vivian Rushmore, Julia Marlow, Frances Starr, Vera Finley. Articles include WHAT THE AMERICAN FLAG HAS DONE FOR ME by George M. Cohan, BILLIE BURKE in Her Home, WHAT IS A JEUVENILE LEAD? by JOHN BARRYMORE. The cover is frameable - nicks at the edges, a few small cuts at the edges, wear on the spine but for something almost 100 years old, I think you will forgive the small stuff! What you see is what you get - I used the digital camera to take the pics cause my scanner wouldn't take in the whole print. The pages of the magazine measure 10" x 14". GORGEOUS SUBDUED COLOR! (look for other fabulous paper I have up in other categories!) NO RESERVE AFTER OPENING BID!! Item.Name: 90 Scifi/Horror Old Time Radio Shows Galore!
Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#ffffff; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#336699; background-color : #ffffff; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #336699; } 90 Scifi/Horror Old Time Radio Shows Galore! Click image to view larger version Click image to view larger version SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT: HORROR-ON-THE-WEB TAKES THIS OPPORTUNITY TO EXTEND PRAYERS AND CONDOLENCES TO THE FAMILY MEMBERS AND FRIENDS OF THE TERRORIST ATTACK VICTIMS. ATTENTION! OLD TIME RADIO AND HORROR FANS! Tired of the daily visual effects of movies_.Wanna take a break from it all_You need_ AMAZING SCI-FI/HORROR OLD TIME RADIO CLASSICS VOLUME ONE CD! This is a tremendous collection of nail-biting tales that scared the tar out of me! Here you_ll find bucket-full of blood-curdling, spine-tingling tales guaranteed to speed up your heart rate a notch or two. 90 CHILLING EPISODES TO BE EXACT! MORE THAN 50 HOURS OF CHILL-TO-THE-BONE TALES! This is an assortment of creepy shows from the Inner Sanctum, Lights Out, Suspense, Escape, Weird Circle, Quiet Please, Nightfall, Mystery Theater, Sealed Book, Dimension X, Murder at Midnight, Dark Fantasy, Haunting Hour, and a host of other popular radio shows of yesteryears! All on one CD filled to the brim for your nightmarish enjoyment! WARNING: Some of these shows are very intense and may not be suitable for the weak at heart! Listen to these stories at night at your own risk! Imagine_. Coming across invaders from Mars_ Running up against men with no mouths_Dodging the ancient curse of the Pharoah_Being stuck in a lighthouse with ravenous rats heading up the stairs towards you with hunger in their blood-shot eyes_Revisiting the infamous Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde_ Feeling the wrath of a vengeful ghost of a doomed man who was left out in the cold to die_ Trying to get away from the Prince of Darkness_ Digging up a sarcophagus with the unthinkable inside_ Coming across a little old lady who may not be that little (and not such a lady)_. Finding a monstrous being behind the locked door_ A dentist who has other agenda on his plate besides fixing teeth_ A camera that takes curious pictures_ Having the ability to make ghosts_ A house possessed by the spirit of a werewolf_ Having to deal with millions of aggravated and flesh-hungry worms squirming around, waiting to get you_ The consequences you had to face when dancing on a gravestone meant death_ Battling an invisible entity that is determined to take over your body and soul... AND THERE IS MORE! A LOT MORE! 90 CHILLING EPISODES IN TOTAL TO BE EXACT! These terrifying tales are all coded in MP3 format and stored on one CD for your convenience. They are beckoning you to listen to them... if you dare... You can listen to them through your PC_s and MAC_s CD-ROM with a downloadable (free) MP3 software like Winamp (goto www.winamp.com). Alternatively, you can also record them on cassette tapes and recordable CDs and listen to them through your cassette player/CD player at your own nighmarish leisure. GREAT AS GIFTS! GREAT FOR YOURSELF! Get them today! Don_t miss out on this fantastic deal! When was the last time, that you were chilled to the bones at about a nickel a story? BUT WAIT... THERE IS MORE... FREE PICTURES! Along with these knee-knocking tales you will also get 15 OLD TIME RADIO SHOW RELATED PICTURES stored in jpeg form. Pictures of Arch Obler (Lights Out creator), Willis Cooper (Quiet Please Creator), Boris Karloff, Vincent Price, Orson Welles, sets from the Inner Sanctum, Lights out and more... AND THIS COMES ALONG WITH YOUR 90 RADIO TALES! FOR FREE! And the deal is not over yet! Along with all the above, you will also get a downloadable FREE MusicMatch Jukebox software that you can install to your computer so you can listen to these radio tales. Everything is here in this awesome deal! This collection gets two shaky paws up from our resident canine critic _ Jasmine! The winning bidder will be responsible for the priority shipping, handling, and confirmation cost of $4.00. Please check out SCI-FI/HORROR OLD-TIME RADIO TALES VOLUME TWO CD, SCI-FI/HORROR OLD-TIME RADIO TALES VOLUME THREE CD, and SCI-FI/HORROR OLD-TIME RADIO TALES VOLUME FOUR CD. If you get any or all of them, the shipping and handling charges are still $4.00! International bidders will be charged the actual shipping and handling charges. Money orders/cashiers checks/PayPal payments will ensure shipping the next business day. Personal checks may take up to 10 business days from receipt (for bank clearance). Item.Name: Bye Bye Birdie VHS Dick Van Dyke Sullivan NIB
Item.Description: Monster on the Campus Bye Bye Birdie VHS Dick Van Dyke Sullivan NIB Bye Bye Birdie You are bidding on a factory sealed VHS, " Bye Bye Birdie " starring Janet Leigh, Dick Van Dyke, Ann-Margret, Maureen Stapleton, Bobby Rydell, Jesse Pearson and Ed Sullivan. Directed by George Sydney. Based on Elvis Presley's decision to join the army at the height of his popularity, this 1963 film introduces rock 'n' roller Conrad Birdie (Jesse Pearson) just before he's off to boot camp. But first, he has to say goodbye to his adoring fans, especially to the beautiful Kim McAfee (Ann-Margaret), who runs a fan club nearby. Suddenly all the kids in town are bucking authority and having far too much fun - which naturally makes the adults nervous. Bye Bye Birdie is a wild romp about the birth of rock and roll and all the change it brought with it. Ann-Margaret's songs are sexy enough to compete with anything Madonna's done on film, while Dick Van Dyke's portrayal of a smooth-talkin' PR man is an eerie look at the direction show biz would take. (NTSC, English, Color, 112 minutes, Hi Fi, 1963) Lucky winner to pay $4.00 surface shipping or $6.00 air mail shipping (US or Can). Item.Description: The Suburbans VHS Starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Will Ferrel, Amy Brennemen, Craig Bierko, Ben Stiller, Jerry Stiller, and Bridgette Wilson This is a previously watched rental, but is in great condition. It is in its original slip cover and runs perfectly! Sort of a cross between That Thing You Do! and Still Crazy, The Suburbans follows a one-hit '80s new-wave band (played by Craig Bierko, Will Ferrell, and cowriters Tony Guma and Donal Lardner Ward) who pull themselves together to play their hit at a wedding and then find themselves pursued by a young record executive (Jennifer Love Hewitt) who wants to revive their careers. The band is enthusiastic until they discover that their rock career is now becoming a a combination of muckraking interviews and intrusive, round-the-clock videotaping _ la VH1's Behind the Music. Item.Name: Pink Floyd: The Wall. NEW Loaded with Extras
Item.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(/abbysrm.gif) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } Pink Floyd: The Wall. NEW Loaded with Extras www. www. cheapassdvds presents: Pink Floyd: The Wall : Cast: Bob Geldof ...Pink Christine Hargreaves ...Pink's Mother James Laurenson ...Pink's Father Eleanor David ...Pink's Wife Kevin McKeon ...Young Pink Bob Hoskins ...Rock and Roll Manager David Bingham ...Little Pink Jenny Wright ...American Groupie Alex McAvoy ...Teacher Ellis Dale ...Doctor James Hazeldine ...Lover Ray Mort ...Playground Father Marjorie Mason ...Teacher's Wife Robert Bridges ...American Doctor Michael Ensign ...Hotel Manager Marie Passarelli ...Spanish Maid Winston Rose ...Security Guard Joanne Whalley ...Pink's Groupie Nell Campbell ...Groupie Emma Longfellow ...Groupie Lorna Barton ...Groupie Rod Bedall ...Roadie Peter Jonfield ...Roadie Philip Davis ...Roadie Gary Olsen ...Roadie Eddie Tagoe ...Minder Dennis Fletcher ...Minder Jonathan Scott ...Registrat Joanna Dickens ...Dancing Teacher John Scott Martin ...Dancing Teacher Marilyn Thomas ...Teacher Brenda Cowling ...Teacher Michael Burrell ...Teacher Malcolm Rogers ...Teacher John Broughton ...Teacher Jon Paul Morgan ...Housekeeper Albert Moses ...Janitor Vincent Wong ...Paramedic Mark Newman ...Paramedic Lucita Lijertwood ...Smash & Grab Lady Betty Whelan ...Smash & Grab Lady David Fleesham ...Man on Station Joanna Andrews ...Wedding Witness Diana King ...Wedding Witness Roger Kemp ...Pink's Friend David Smythe Keith Wray ...Pink's Friend Roger Waters ...Wedding scene (cameo) Special Features: Color, Animated, Widescreen, Dolby, Collector's Edition Commentary by Pink Floyd's Roger Waters and animation director Gerald Scarfe Production notes Theatrical trailer(s) Previously Released Making-Of Documentary: The Other Side Of The Wall (1982, 25 min.) New Documentary: Retrospective (45 min.), interviews with the cast and filmmakers Previously unreleased footage for the song Hey You Production Stills Gallery Widescreen anamorphic format DVD Details : Release Information: Studio: Sony Wonder Theatrical Release Date: August 6, 1982 DVD Release Date: December 2, 1999 Run Time: 100 minutes Production Company: Sony Entertainment Package Type: Keep Case Aspect Ratio(s): Widescreen Anamorphic - 2.35:1 Discographic Information: DVD Encoding: Region 1 Layers: Dual Available Audio Tracks: English (Dolby Digital 5.1) Available subtitles: English, Spanish, French Synopsis: The story of The Wall is told simply with the music of Pink Floyd, images and natural effects. There is no conventional dialogue to progress the narrative. Our story is about Pink, a rock and roll performer, who sits locked in a hotel room, somewhere in Los Angeles. Too many shows, too much dope, too much applause: a burned out case. On the TV, an all-too-familiar war film flickers on the screen. We shuffle time and place, reality and nightmare, as we venture into Pink's painful memories, each one a 'brick' in the wall he has gradually built around his feelings. Slowly he withdraws from the real world and slips further into his nightmare as he imagines himself as an unfeeling demagogue, for whom all that is left is the demonstration of power over his unthinking audience, the culmination of the odious excess of his own world and the world around him. His internal self trial follows, as the witnesses of his past life, the very people who have contributed to the building of the wall, come forward and testify against him. --Alan Parker Pink Floyd The Wall: Deluxe DVD Edition features: New Hi-Definition film transfer from the original widescreen interpositive. Previously unreleased footage. Remastered 5.1 Dolby Digital and Surround Encoded PCM Stereo Soundtracks from the original master tapes. The Other Side Of The Wall: A 25-minute documentary about the making of the film. Running commentary from Roger Waters and Gerald Scarfe. Retrospective: A new 45-minute documentary with interviews with Roger Waters, Gerald Scarfe, Alan Parker, Peter Biziou, Alan Marshall and James Guthrie. Original film trailer and production stills. Newly designed interactive menus. Subtitles scene/song selection and secret buttons. Technical Sound System Set Up. CheapassDvds is proud to offer this auction to you! The DVD(s) are Brand New and Sealed!! More than happy to ship anywhere in the world!!!! Payments accepted: Bidpay.com, Cash, Money Orders, energyflow.com, payingfast.com, Bank Money orders!! Buyer agrees to pay $3.00 shipping/handling in North America, and $5.00 anywhere else in the world. Good Luck. Bid on more than one DVD and save $$ on postage!! Canadian bidders outside Ontario will need to add the GST. Bidders in New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Newfoundland will add the HST. Bid with Confidence, we are Ebay Powersellers! Item.Name: Jazz Scene 1962 Stan Kenton Rosolino *new VHS
Item.Location: Philadelphia, The city that loves you back !
Item.Description: USE THE "BUY IT NOW" FEATURE AND GET FREE MEDIA MAIL SHIPPING IN THE UNITED STATES!! You are bidding on a BRAND NEW(factory sealed) VHS video of JAZZ SCENE 1962 USA's broadcast of STAN KENTON and FRANK ROSOLINO. This nationally syndicated television program, the brainchild of life-long jazz devotee Steve Allen, was a series which showcases many jazz performers. Uncompromising in its use of imaginative camera angles, the visual style is on par with the creativity of the music. These shows are time capsules to treasure from America's golden age of television. FRANK ROSOLINO (1926-1978) was quite simply one of the most brilliant trombone stylists in jazz history. His exceptional technique and exuberant personality sent bolts of intensity through every solo. After extensive experience in the big bands of Bob Chester, Glen Gray, Gene Krupa, with whom he recorded and filmed the delightful Lemon Drop, Tony Pastor, Herbie Fields and Stan Kenton, plus the wonderful 1951 Georgie Auld Quartet, he settled in Los Angeles in 1954. It wasn't long before ROSOLINO was trombonist numero uno on the West Coast, working regularly with the Lighthouse All Stars, and frequently getting calls for record, film and TV studio work. His rhythm section on this broadcast included a young Mike Melvoin on piano, bassist Bob Bertaux, and drummer Nick Martinis. The set consists mostly of standards: Yesterdays (at an unusually fast tempo) Mean To Me Please Don't Bug Me Lover Man and Thelonious Monk's Well You Needn't The stature of STAN KENTON (1912-1979) in the pantheon of big band jazz remains unchallenged to this day, more than fifty years after he made his first waves in the early 1940's. Committed to music education and the nurturing of young talent, through his band's ranks passed many of modern jazz's most compelling performers, including Art Pepper, Stan Getz, Shelly Manne, Maynard Ferguson, Anita O'Day, June Christy, Lee Konitz, Frank Rosolino, Conte Condoli, and Mel Lewis, to name just a few. Kenton's controversial emphasis on composition in the jazz idiom encouraged the work of such writers as Pete Rugolo, Bill Russo, Gerry Mulligan and Shorty Rogers. Marvin Stamm is on trumpet, Don Menza on tenor, and Bob Fitzpatrick on trombone are featured here along with Kenton performing: Limehouse Blues All The Things You Are Waltz of the Prophets Maria Malaguena The video is 60 minutes in length, recorded in SP Mode/RealTime. Winning bidder (Other than the "BUY IT NOW" winner) to pay an additional $2.50 for Media Mail, $3.50 for First Class Mail OR $4.50 for Priority Mail in the US. Optional insurance is available @ $1.10 per item. Also, with the holiday season upon us, we will gift wrap and send your package to a third person as a gift. Fees apply. Foreign rates apply per country of destination. Paypal is gladly accepted! Please see our feedback and bid with confidence. Also, check our other auctions and save a little money when you combine the shipping of two or more winning items. Thank you and good luck.

Item.Name: ON VALENTINE'S DAY An American Love Story VHS
Item.Description: ON VALENTINE'S DAY VHS An American Love Story AKA On Valentine's Day - Story of a Marriage . Set in the American South, a small town. From the play Valentine's Day by Horton Foote . A prequel to Horton Foote's 1918 (released in 1985) On Valentine's Day was filmed in 1984, then held back from release till 1986. On the titular day, Elizabeth Vaughn ( Hallie Foote, Horton's daughter) and Horace Robedeaux ( William Converse-Roberts ) elope. Horace stubbornly refuses to ask for financial assistance from his parents or in-laws, so the penniless couple is compelled to live in an inexpensive boarding house. Their fellow tenants are the usual assortment of eccentrics, including alcoholic Bobby Pate ( Richard Jenkins ), spinster Miss Ruth ( Carol Goodheart ), heartbroken George Tyler ( Steven Hill ) and garrulous young Bessie ( Jeanne McCarthy ). After several months of enduring the woes of the other boarders, Horace swallows his pride and agrees to allow father-in-law Michael Higgins to support him and Elizabeth . There's a reconciliation, but one tinged with the premonition that Horace and Elizabeth aren't out of the woods yet. Together with Portrait of a Marriage (never released theatrically), On Valentine's Day and 1918 were later reedited and incorporated into a Horton Foote TV trilogy on the PBS network. Director Ken Harrison . Starring: William Converse-Roberts, Hallie Foote, Michael Higgins, Steven Hill, Richard Jenkins, Carol Goodheart, Jeanne McCarthy, Matthew Broderick . Explicit Language, Adult Situations, Questionable for Children. Produced by American Playhouse / Angelika Films / Guadalupe / Hudson / Lumiere Prods. 1984. Running time: 106 min. Made for TV. Item.Name: FROM DUSK TILL DAWN George Clooney WIDESCREEN
Item.Description: Dimension Home Video; 1996; SP Mode; Rated; R; 108 Minutes; WIDESCREEN. This tape comes from my personal collection and has only been watched a couple of times. Both box and tape are in near excellent condition. The wild imaginations of Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez team up for an over-the-top blast combination of vampires and gangsters that has become a cult legend. Tarantino and George Clooney are convict brothers on the run who take Harvey Keitel and his family, including daughter Juliette Lewis hostage. They go to a Mexican truck stop for a meet that turns into a nightmare when it turns out that the employees of the bar are all a bunch of vampires. Soon, there's only a handful of humans left. The action and gore are nearly nonstop, and the film plays much better in the widescreen mode. Look for Salma Hayek as a sexy vampire, along with Fred Hammer Williamson, special effects whiz Tom Savini and Cheech Marin (playing three different characters) in supporting roles. Item.Description: Brought To You By click4stuff A AL HIRT LIVE ON BOURBON STREET VHS Brand New and Factory Shrink Wrapped. Running Time: 76 Min In 1962, Al Hirt was named best jazz trumpeter in the Playboy Magazine Jazz Poll (and won for the next 15 years) and opened his own club on Bourbon Street where he performed for the next 21 years. In succeeding years he was either a Grammy nominee (8 times) or Winner for Honey In The Horn, Java (a Grammy gold for best single recording in 1963) and another gold album award for The Best of Al Hirt . Most recently, he was inducted into the international jazz Hall of Fame having been recognized for his _incomparable and unique contributions in the development and perpetuation of American Jazz._ More recording dates and TV appearances have followed but nothing more captures the man and his music than his live appearances in Bourbon Street. Item.Name: BEAT THE DEVIL DVD-HUMPHREY BOGART & P. LORRE
Item.Description: BEAT THE DEVIL. (COLLECTOR'S EDITION) This dvd is new and is factory sealed. This awesome movie was released in 1954. Retails for $19.99. Starring Humprey Bogart, Peter Lorre, and Jennifer Jones. Directed by John Huston. Four low-life crooks as well as their "associate" (Bogart) are en route to Africa, but are stuck in Italy because of their broken down steamer. They Plan on making their way down to East Africa to some land rich in uranium and make off with it. While there, Bogart and his wife (Lollobrigida) meet up with a British couple (Jones and Underdown) who plan to run a coffee plantation in Africa. All eight get back on the now repaired steemer and once agaon set out to Africa...the boa floods and everyone abandons ship. They wind up on shore and are taken in by a violent band of Arabs...and then the adventure reaaly begins! 93 minutes. 1954. Digitallt Remastered. Includes special features. Item.Name: JANE POWELL-MEX MINI-POSTER-DALMATIONS!!
Item.Description: MEXICAN MEMORABILIA! Quality Collectibles Since 2000! Just in time for Christmas_here are several neat movie-related items from M_xico! They will make someone very happy Christmas morning! Happy Holidays, and God bless. Take a look at our new website! Link below! Mexican lobby cards are larger (12.50 x 16.75) and often more colorful and action-packed than other lobbies. They usually come in a set of eight, with brightly colored artwork and a black and white inset photo which varies from card to card. These are actual, theater used posters. They come from a collector friend whose mother-in-law worked for a film distributor in M_xico City. She saved the ones she liked, and stored them carefully. They are a historical treasure today! Here's a wonderful Jane Powell item! It's a mini poster from Mexico, probably meant to be a calendar top, with Jane all dalmationed out. A good size 11.74 x 14.5 inches. Sweet and a bit campy--Jane looks great! Take a look at all my auctions--where else but at Mexican Memorabilia can you consistently find such a high percentage of unusual, quality collectibles you never see anywhere else? If you have trouble seeing my photos, please drop me a line and I will e- them out to you. CONDITION: Very light wear, two small tack holes!_See Photo! SHIPPING: $5.00 US, actual shipping cost overseas. We will combine orders whenever possible. Remember, shipping includes sending all items first from Mexico to Mom by special carrier, so they arrive with you safe, sound, and secure. I'm in Mexico looking for more stuff, but the treasures are in our New York warehouse (at Ma's) so shipping is quick and easy. PAYMENT WITHIN 10 DAYS, PLEASE! Money Orders much preferred--we mail to you within 24 hours. Personal Checks must clear, and total turnaround is often three weeks. Cash is swell, but send it at your risk! Remember, now you can use your credit card to pay with BidPay! Just click on their banner below. Please check out the other great auctions I currently have running on eBay. Take a look at our BRAND NEW Mexican Memorabilia web site! Most Mexican houses have no attic, so things like movie memorabilia and ephemera rarely get saved! I've been here in Guadalajara seven years, and it's taken me that long to make good collecting connections and know where to look. Collect movie star/TV star magazines? Lobby cards, movie-related displays and promotions? Advertisements? We've got all kinds of stuff, from the teens to the 60's. Speaking of all kinds of stuff--if you haven_t been to Bruce Hershenson_s, you are really missing out! Bruce has an incredible movie poster site, sells hundreds and hundreds of posters a week at auction, and hosts a movie poster e-mail club that is absolutely the best way to keep up with the hobby! Plus he_s one of the two nicest guys on the net (I_m the other one!). In e-Bay, just go to _search bidder_ and type emovieposter.com. Or see Bruce_s site at http://www.brucehershenson.com/emovieposter.htm . You can sign up for the poster club e-letter there. You_ll be glad you did! Item.Name: 12 Horror movies Movie for CD-ROM DVD-ROM
Item.Description: 12 Horror movies Movie for CD-ROM DVD-ROM A retail value of $179.76! Enjoy these 12 horror movies on your PC! MovieCD's are new and in original, un-opened packaging. MovieCD uses compression technology to deliver great looking video to your computer screen. Watch a MovieCD while using applications such as word processing, spreadsheets, E-mail, the Internet and others. OR, take a break from work.... MovieCD titles included in this package are: A Nightmare on Elm Street, IV: The Dream Master Wes Craven's New Nightmare ARCADE PUPPET MASTER Subspecies Trancers III Night of the Living Dead Leprechaun 1 Leprechaun 2 Warlock Warlock: The Armageddon Witchcraft Check out the horror movies on CD-ROM in my eBay store. A Nightmare on Elm Street, IV: The Dream Master Your fave psycho sandman is back! It's that one-man-sleep-disorder, the unspeakably demonic FREDDY KRUEGER, returning with a vengeance in A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master! But wait. This time around, the fiendish Freddy (ROBERT ENGLUND) is up against a powerful new adversary! After beautiful young Kristen sees the remaining Elm Street kids succumb one by one to Freddy's razor-edged wrath, she embarks on a desperate mission to release the tortured souls of Freddy's victims once and for all. Can this lone "Dream Master" defeat the satanic dreamstalker? Or will she have to wake up to the fact that no one is really ready...for Freddy? A special-effects-filled descent into sheer, unrelenting terror! Wes Craven's New Nightmare From the creator of "A Nightmare on Elm Street," Freddy's back and scarier than ever! As he slashes his way through the silver screen and turns reality blood red. Heather is an actress happily married, with a little boy named Dylan. She is worried about a maniac who is ringing frequently at her house. She thinks the maniac is Freddy, the killer of her previous film. Meanwhile, Wes Craven is having nightmares. Inspired by those events, he is writing the script for a new Nightmare series film. Heather is scared by some recent murders, as well as her son's schizophrenia. The only way left to save her son is to act for the last time, and play the part of Nancy to defeat Freddy forever. ARCADE All the kids in town are dying to play the hot new video game ARCADE. Trouble is, once you play the game you can kiss reality good-bye. Arcade has seven levels of excitement, adventure and terror for its players. The game transports you to another world with its stunning graphics, thrilling sound effects, and virtual reality simulation. It is the ultimate experience in a video game. But excitement like this doesn't come cheaply - when you battle with ARCADE you're putting your life on the line. The kids have accepted the challenge and are absorbed into the game. Only Alex (Megan Ward) realizes that their mysterious disappearances are linked to ARCADE. She must battle the game, alone. Too bad she's never been very good at games... PUPPET MASTER Alex Whitaker, played by Paul Le Mat ("Melvin and Howard", "The Burning Bed"), and three other gifted psychics are investigating rumors that the secret of life has been discovered by master puppeteer Andre Toulon, played by William Hickey ("Prizzi's Honor", "The Name of the Game"). But the psychics quickly discover Toulon's secret of death in the form of five killer puppets -- each one uniquely qualified for murder and mayhem. Together, they're an army of skilled assassins, diabolically programmed to guard the deadly secrets of the Puppet Master. Subspecies Deep within the heart of Transylvania, a dark power from the past has resurfaced, and three beautiful young research students are caught in the midst of a supernatural battle for control of the vampire kingdom. Blood is the tie that binds the good Stefan (Michael Watson) and the evil Radu (Anders Hove), vampire brothers reunited by the death of their father, King Vlad (Angus Scrimm). Radu creates an army of hellish creatures of the night-subspecies-to help him in his wicked quest. Stefan has love on his side as Michelle (Laura Tate), one of the students, joins him in the desperate fight to save the kingdom from the terrifying rule of Radu. Trancers III The best of the Trancers series. A time traveling cop from the future, Jack Deth, is taken back to the past. He is given the task of destroying the Trancer program before it has a chance to get out of control which could send the world into a state of chaos and war. Night of the Living Dead Enjoy the ORIGINAL grotesque classic that spawned a new generation of horror films. Murder and mayhem run amuck in a lonely backwoods cemetery as ravenous ghouls seek the flesh of the living. Share Barbara's horror as she is chased into a home where the undead wait for her. Ben battles the relentless pursuit of the undead while trying to protect the potential victims. Who will survive the night? Leprechaun 1 Horrific Leprechaun goes on a rampage after his precious bag of gold coins is stolen. He uses all of his magical destruction powers to trick, terrorize anyone who is unlucky enough to hinder his relentless search. In a frantic attempt to survive the wrath of Leprechaun, Tori and her friends scranble to find the only weapon known to kill this Irish monster..a four leaf clover. Leprechaun 2 A thousand years ago, the Leprechaun, Warwick Davis ("Willow", "Leprechaun"), left a bloody trail when he ripped through the countryside in search of his stolen pot of gold. Now he's back in the big city using all of his deadly tricks to snare the girl of his nightmares. His bloody quest becomes more deadly when her boyfriend steals one of the Irish monster's precious gold coins. The town soon discovers two dead bodies and a trail of gold dust leads them to the Leprechaun's lair. It's a pot full O'blood, guts and horror as the Leprechaun goes on a wild rampage filled with grisly thrills and gruesome special effects. Warlock In 1691, they toruted the Warlock and lock him in chains. He was braded a witch and sentenced to die... but something went wrong... and now, 300 years later, he's back. Evil magic confronts the strength of righteousness with mankind's furture at stake. Warlock: The Armageddon In this spine-tingling, pulse pounding sequel to Warlock, Satan'sonly son returns with a single goal to free his fater from the flery chains that inprison him and unleash Satan's wrath upon the world. With only seven days to gather six magic runstones that together create the Arnageddon, time is of the essence. two warriors with supernatural powers are the only ones who can prevent complete world destruction. Witchcraft In 1667 a young couple, awaiting the birth of their first child, are burnt at the stake for practicing witchcraft and dark satanic rites. After wandering the depths of hell for three hundred years these disciples of satan have returned reeking vengeance, posing as mother and son, to prey and feed on innocent young women. Deception, lust, seduction and betrayal are the tools of their trade...and nothing after three hundred years will stop them until their demon child is born, a son of satan! Item.Name: 1962 UNCLE WETHBEE'S NYC WEATHER ALMANAC!
Item.Description: 1962 UNCLE WETHBEE'S NEW YORK WEATHER ALMANAC - WITH TEX ANTOINE - PUBLISHED BY CON EDISON Rembember Tex Antoine and Uncle Wethbee? If you lived in the New York City area in the 1950's and 60's you certainly should! Tex was the weatherman on NBC Channel 4, sponsored by Con Edison (Consolidated Edison Power & Light), and Uncle Wethbee was his "magnetic" cartoon sidekick. Unk's large bald head was on a large board, and Tex would add magnetized hair, mustaches, hats, scarves, etc., depending on the forecast (Did you know that each of Unk's garments or hairstyles had a different weather meaning? - Find out what they were in this great little booklet). This booklet measures 5 1/2" x 8 1/4" and has 30 pages (including covers) chock full of information about weather, monthly weather almanac, Con Edison ads, a picture of the late Tex and facsimile signature. Tex was famous, or infamous, for showing up on the air three sheets to the wind, and was once suspended for adivising women rape victims to "lie back and enjoy it." He also went through an on-air crying jag one New Year's Eve, when his estranged spouse (an actress) appeared in a commercial which was aired during his broadcast ("...That was my wife...). Good condition with some light wear and surface soiling and browning. Hole punched at upper left is original to the piece for distribution. Ships for $1.25. This will enable us to put many items up during the Holiday Season that we would otherwise have to delay. Please understand that all auctions closing after January 2nd will not be invoiced until January 21st, and orders not qualifying for shipment by January 2nd will be delayed for the same period. We apologize for any inconvenience, and we hope you understand. Best Wishes to all of our valued customers for a Happy Holiday Season and a prosperous New Year 2002! Item.Name: Jodorowsky's THE HOLY MOUNTAIN (1975)
Item.Description: Jodorowsky's THE HOLY MOUNTAIN (1975) Directed by: Alejandro Jodorowsky Produced by: Abkco films Rating: USA: R Language: English Runtime: 114 mins. Sound Mix: Mono It doesn't get stranger than this. We follow a Christ-like figure through parades of flayed and crucified lambs, frogs and lizards dressed as priests and conquistadors trampling a model Mayan city, a hall full of life-size plaster replicas of the main character; eventually he is pulled from this chaos by a guru-figure, played by Jodorowsky himself_ people from other planets embark on a quest to find the Holy Mountain. They plan to attain godhood by murdering the monks of the mountain. Is that all clear? Even people who love El Topo are often cool to The Holy Mountain because it's 'too weird.' In English with Japanese subtitles. 114m. This video tape copy is sourced from a Japanese Laser Disc. Hard case and Japanese video tape color artwork included. Item.Name: Mame-vhs-Lucille Ball-Beatrice Arthur
Item.Location: Corkdorks Of Tx.-Sub. Of Wally B# Productions
Item.Description: This video is new. Plastic been removed. Starring Lucille Ball, Beatrice Arthur, Bruce Davison, Joyce Van Patten, Kirby Furlong and Robert Preston. She throws parties for every occasion- or nonoccasion- that comes to mind. Circles the globe and files high on cardboard moons. Gallops to victory in a fox hunt the first time she ever mounts a horse. She's Mame Dennis, one of the most beloved stage and screen characters of the last 30 years. And Mame, the 1974 film edition of the 1966 Broadway musical smash, is the latest- and most glittering- appearance of the madcap for whom " life is a banquet. " Playing Mame is another well-loved lady. In her final theatrical film, the late Lucille Ball invested Mame with the glamour that inspired photography experts to dub her " Technicolor Tessie " for her alluring blues eyes and gorgeous, open face. A former Goldwyn Girl from early movie musicals, Lucy's right in step with a high-kicking chorus and right on target with punchliness and pratfalls. On hand from New York original are TV Golden Girl Beatrice Arthur, delightfully reprising her Tony Award-winning role as venomously vampy Vera Charles; Jane Connell as the ever-befuddled governess Agnes Gooch; and two of Broadway's best magic-makers: chorographer Onna White and the three-time Tony-winning director Gene Saks. Joining the club as Mame's husband Beauregard, The Music Man's Robert Preston sings the liting " Loving You, " written especially for the film by Jerry Herman ( Hello, Dolly! La Cage aux Folles ). His tunes for Mame, from the uptempo " It's Today " and " We Need a Little Christmas " to pensive " My Best Girl " and " If He Walked into My Life, " rank among Broadway's best. So light the candles, get the ice out, roll the rug up. And be sure to invite Mame. We do NOT participate in any credit card or pay through programs. Item.Name: THE AVENGERS Companion/Fr. hardcover w/photos
Item.Description: This is a rare and beautiful, lavishly illustrated episode guides to that classic television show "The Avengers." Published by Huitieme Art in 1990 under the name "Chapeau Melon et Bottes de Cuir", the text is in French (it was written by Alain Carraze and Jean-Luc Putheaud) although episode titles are in English. The true appeal of this book, however, are the amazing color and black and white photos, which cover episodes from the entire run of the show, from ground breaker Honor Blackman ("Goldfinger's" Pussy Galore) to the unforgettable Diana Rigg to Linda Thorson and Ab Fab's Joanna Lumley, and of course, the wonderful Patrick MacNee. In excellent condition, including an unblemished dust jacket, this is a must for fans of the series. It'll bring back every memory--even if you don't speak French! Just $19.95--no reserve! See my other listings for similar books on "The Prisoner" and "Secret Agent." Priority mail shipping including insurance is $7.55. I prefer Paypal but also accept Billpoint/eBay Payments, money orders and cashiers checks only.

Item.Name: Homeboy/Blockbuster previewed
Item.Description: New Page 1 Happy Holidays Everyone! This is a Blockbuster Previewed Movie and it is in very good condition. MOVIE Homeboy Alternate Title: Los Angeles de Carlitos -- Release Year: 1988 Cast: Mickey Rourke, Christopher Walken, Debra Feuer, Thomas Quinn, Kevin Conway, Anthony Alda Director: Michael Seresin Categories: Drama Rated: R (Violence, Brief Nudity, Adult Situations, Questionable for Children, Explicit Language, Profanity ) Running Time: 118 minutes SYNOPSIS Johnny Walker (Mickey Roarke) is a punch-drunk and alcoholic cowboy pugilist who gives boxing one last shot in Asbury Park, New Jersey. He meets Wesley Pendergrass (Christopher Walken), the smooth-talking hood who tries to talk Johnny into helping in the heist of a jewelry store. Johnny considers the offer but elects to enter the ring to help Ruby (Debra Feuer) and her financially troubled arcade with the prize money. He agrees to the bout despite the fact that a blow to his fractured temple bone could kill him. Plodding, pretentious, and cliche-ridden, Walken's performance is the highlight of this grim film. Roarke sued to stop the release of the feature, claiming that the money and creative control promised to him was never delivered. Music is provided by Eric Clapton and Michael Kamen. ~ Dan Pavlides, All Movie Guide Buy now and get your Items by Christmas.... *** TERMS*** *Please direct all questions to smrtdsgn1@aol.com *Shipping is set at $5.00 and I'm sorry but I am unable to give multiple item shipping discounts at this time.
